text: a nice place to worship God. The people there are friendly. l enjoyed the hospitality

Built in 1982, this is a nice, quiet and peaceful Roman Catholic Church located within 10 mins walk from Ang Mo Kio mrt. The church is very convenient for those living in Ang Mo Kio area as there are many bus services that takes you there too.

I was baptized and confirmed in this church, and it holds a special place in my heart. In the past, it was a vibrant and welcoming community, especially for the youth. We spent countless hours hanging out there, feeling a genuine sense of belonging. However, in recent years, the church seems to have lost some of that warmth. The modern renovations covering up the lovely marble with boring carpets and railings everywhere,  have made it feel more formal and less inviting. There also seems to be a disconnect between the church and its congregation, with fewer efforts to engage the community. To add to this, my experience with one of the administrative staff, Agatha, was particularly disappointing due to her rudeness. I sincerely hope the church can rediscover its former spirit of openness and community, bringing back the welcoming atmosphere that once made it so special.
How can u accept children being forced by parent to ur classes? This place don't even require both parents signature and consent???

Lovely church.. Main church layout is in a circular structure with cross hanging from the middle of the ceiling . Beautiful Mother Mary statue. Need to take a bus from AMK interchange or mrt. About 3 stops down.  You will see the church opposite of bus stop from AMK mrt/ interchange.
